2:
"Permit me to speak a little longer, and I will show you some things\q because I have a little more to say in defense of God.
\q
3:
I will obtain my knowledge from far off;\q I will acknowledge that righteousness belongs to my Maker.


\q
4:
For indeed, my words will not be false;\q someone who is mature in knowledge is with you.
\q
5:
See, God is mighty, and despises no one;\q he is mighty in strength of understanding.


\q
6:
He does not preserve the life of wicked people\q but instead does what is right for those who suffer.
\q
7:
He does not withdraw his eyes from righteous people\q but instead sets them on thrones like kings forever,
\q and they are lifted up.


\q
8:
If they are bound in chains\q and trapped in cords of suffering,
\q
9:
then he reveals to them what they have done,\q and their transgressions and their pride.


\q
10:
He also opens their ears to his instruction,\q and commands them to turn back from iniquity.
\q
11:
If they listen to him and worship him,\q they will spend their days in prosperity,
\q their years in contentment.
\q
12:
However, if they do not listen, they will perish by the sword;\q they will die because they have no knowledge.


\q
13:
Those who are godless in heart store up their anger;\q they do not cry out for help even when God ties them up.
\q
14:
They die in their youth;\q their lives end among the cultic prostitutes.


\q
15:
God rescues afflicted people by means of their afflictions;\q he opens their ears by means of their oppression.
\q
16:
Indeed, he would like to draw you out of distress\q into a broad place where there is no hardship
\q and where your table would be set with food full of fatness.


\q
17:
But you are full of judgment on wicked people;\q judgment and justice have laid hold of you.
\q
18:
Do not let your anger entice you to mockery,\q or the greatness of a ransom to turn you aside.


\q
19:
Can your wealth benefit you, so that you will not be in distress,\q or can all the force of your strength help you?
\q
20:
Do not desire the night, to commit sin against others,\q when peoples are cut off in their place.
\q
21:
Be careful that you do not turn to sin\q because you are being tested by suffering so that you will stay away from sinning.


\q
22:
See, God is exalted in his power;\q who is a teacher like him?
\q
23:
Who has ever instructed him about his way?\q Who can ever say to him, 'You have committed unrighteousness?'
\q
24:
Remember to praise his deeds,\q of which people have sung.


\q
25:
All people have looked on those deeds,\q but they see those deeds only from far away.
\q
26:
See, God is great, but we do not understand him well;\q the number of his years is incalculable.


\q
27:
For he draws up the drops of water\q that he distills as rain from his vapor,
\f + \ft Some modern versions have \fqa that distill as rain from his vapor \fqa* . \f*
\q
28:
which the clouds pour down\q and drop in abundance on mankind.
\q
29:
Indeed, can anyone understand the extensive spread of the clouds\q and the thunder from his hut?


\q
30:
See, he spreads his lightning around him\q and covers the roots of the sea.
\q
31:
In this way he judges the peoples\q and gives food in abundance.


\q
32:
He fills his hands with the lightning\q until he commands it to strike its mark.
\q
33: Its thunder warns of the storm,\q the cattle can also hear it is coming.
